isis.stitle: DOUBLE DIAPHRAGM ANCHORLOK SPRING BRAKE - SAFETY CHAMBER

svcproc.title: SAFETY CHAMBER

warning.para: A Double Diaphragm Spring Brake assembly must be disarmed before disposal, or forceful release of the compression spring may occur in the future without warning which can cause personal injury or death.

svcproc.para: Once a Double Diaphragm Spring Brake assembly has been removed from the vehicle, uncage the compression spring when applicable.

step1.para: Place the Double Diaphragm Spring Brake assembly inside a safety chamber for disarming. Close the lid on the safety chamber and lock closed. (The service pushrod may need to be cut off for the assembly to fit in the safety chamber.)
While wearing safety glasses, use an acetylene cutting torch and cut a 1/2 inch by 1-1/2-inch segment out of the spring brake chamber wall through one of the openings in the safety chamber.

Once the compression spring is exposed, use the acetylene cutting torch to cut the exposed spring in one or more places until the compression spring can be moved around inside the spring brake chamber with a long screwdriver or similar tool.
